page.title: 03SUPERSTITIONS - GHOSTS.
page.content: {LILY LUMLEY - (14th century)} was a Protestant. Secretly, priests tried to return her to the Catholic religion. She refused.The priests killed her and flung her body down a well. Lily's ghost has supposedly been seen rising from that same well in Lumley Castle. {ANNE WALKER -(17th cent), }housekeeper for a male relative, was thought to be pregnant and banished from his home escorted by Mark Sharp, a collier, and her employer, Walker. She disappeared. Sometime later, her bloodstained ghost appeared to a local miller. She informed him Sharp had attacked her and flung her body down a disused shaft.Eventually the terrified miller told a magistrate. A search revealed her body and other evidence which led to the conviction of both men. A child's ghost was seen on Walker's shoulders during the trial.{ A.Robson.
